CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the length of the proceedings;Inadmissible under Art. 6-1 with regard to the fairness of the proceedings;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . Since DATE , the applicant ’s relatives , GPE and ORG , have occupied a part of the applicant ’s property , with the agreement of the applicant . It appears that GPE and FAC carried out construction work on the property which provoked a conflict between them and the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) in which he asked the court to order the eviction of GPE and ORG from his property .

CARDINAL . On DATE the trial court held a hearing at which it gave a default judgment ( wyrok zaoczny ) . The court allowed the applicant ’s action and ordered that the judgement be immediately enforceable .
CARDINAL . The defendants lodged an objection against the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing at which it allowed the applicant ’s motions to hear witnesses and to hold a viewing of the property . Subsequently , the trial court requested a copy of the casefile concerning another set of civil proceedings instituted by the defendants against the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided to stay the proceedings until the termination of the second set of proceedings , instituted by the defendants , in which they claimed that they had acquired the title to the property in question by prescription ( stwierdzenie nabycia własności poprzez zasiedzenie ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant appealed against the decision to stay the proceedings ; however , on DATE ORG dismissed his appeal .
CARDINAL . Subsequently on several occasions , the applicant applied to resume the proceedings .

CARDINAL . In DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE and DATE the trial court requested ORG of ORG to provide information concerning the state of the proceedings concerning the acquisition of property by prescription .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to resume the proceedings . He submitted that the second set of proceedings for acquisitive prescription had ended on DATE with the secondinstance court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed his application and resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the defendants informed the court that the second set of proceedings was still pending because they had lodged a cassation appeal . Consequently , on DATE , ORG again decided to stay the proceedings .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against this decision , but on DATE his appeal was rejected as he had failed to pay the fees for the appeal .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , the applicant applied to the court to issue a writ of enforcement of the default judgment of DATE . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed his application on the grounds that the proceedings were stayed .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Wojewódzki ) quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the application concerning the writ of enforcement for reconsideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to resume the proceedings . He submitted that the second set of the proceedings had ended with ORG decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court allowed the application and resumed the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and gave judgment . It upheld the default judgment of DATE and suspended the enforcement order .
CARDINAL . The defendants lodged an appeal against the judgment with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the appellate court stayed the proceedings because the defendants had instituted yet another set of proceedings against the applicant . They sought a judgment stipulating that the applicant was obliged to make a declaration of will ( oswiadczenie woli ) in the form of a consent to the sale of the property in question . ORG found that the proceedings for eviction should be stayed as the determination of the case depended on the outcome of this third set of proceedings .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant applied to resume the proceedings .
CARDINAL . Several times in DATE and DATE the trial court requested information regarding the state of the third set of proceedings . Apparently , they were still pending at the time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was informed that the third set of proceedings had ended . As a result , on DATE , the court resumed the eviction proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing at which it appointed a lawyer under the legal aid scheme for the defendants .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment in which it dismissed the GPE appeal .
CARDINAL . It appears that subsequently the defendants tried to re - open the proceedings .
CARDINAL . Under Sections CARDINAL et seq . of ORG the court may stay civil proceedings either ex officio or at the parties’ request .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Code , in so far as relevant , provides :
“ CARDINAL . The court shall ex officio stay the proceedings :
CARDINAL ) NORP if the determination of the case depends on the outcome of other pending civil proceedings ; ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the LAW , insofar as relevant , provides :
“ CARDINAL . The court shall ex officio resume the proceedings if the reason for staying them has ceased to exist , in particular when :

CARDINAL ) a final decision has been given in the proceedings on whose outcome the determination of the claim depends ; however , if it is justified , the court may resume the proceedings before [ any such decision is taken ] . ”
